title: Events
custom_preconds:
Head to Head installed on the device
User has successfully logged in and has players selected

For more details and mockups:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/fantasy/Scoring+Tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify each event contains the following information:
Player Name
Player Photo
Event
Event Points
Event Scoring Description
Inning and Score
Timestamp
Contest List
Social Share Button
At Bat Button
Facebook button
Twitter button
Google+ button
Message button

title: Sharing
custom_preconds:
User has Head to Head installed on the device
User is logged in and in an active challenge

For some of these tests user will need to have certain applications or settings setup such as Facebook

See the following link for additional details on how the pre-populated messages will appear:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/fantasy/Scoring+Tab#ScoringTab-SocialSharingTemplate

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap the Smack Talk button
custom_steps_separated.expected: This will show/hide the Social sharing icons

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event where the user is leading, tap Facebook icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Post to Facebook flow is launched and pre-populated text appears displaying the player name, the event that occurred, the score in relation to the user and poses a question if the user's opponent can come back.

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event where the user is trailing, tap Facebook icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Post to Facebook flow is launched and pre-populated text appears displaying the player name, the event that occurred, the score in relation to the user's opponent (their team name) and poses a question if the user's opponent can hold on.

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event where the user is now tied, tap Facebook icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Post to Facebook flow is launched and pre-populated text appears displaying the player name, the event that occurred, the score in relation to the user and poses a question if the user's opponent can take control.

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event where the user is challenging multiple opponents, tap Facebook icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Post to Facebook flow is launched and pre-populated text appears displaying the player name, the event that occurred, and "The action is nonstop!"

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap Cancel
custom_steps_separated.expected: Dialog closes and no information is posted to Facebook

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap on Facebook icon and tap Post
custom_steps_separated.expected: Pre-populated messaged is posted to the Facebook page of the previously configured Facebook account

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap on Facebook icon and tap Post (with Facebook not configured for the device)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Message appears that a Facebook account must be configured to use this feature

(confirm when this flow is blocked - when tapping icon or when attempting to post)

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event tap Twitter icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Twitter sharing flow behaves correctly
-Flow can be canceled without posting anything to Twitter
-Message appears if Twitter has not be configured on the device and prevents sharing
-Pre-populated text appears correctly based on the user's challenge situation

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event tap Google+ icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Google+ sharing flow behaves correctly
-Flow can be canceled without posting anything to Google+
-Message appears if Google+ has not be configured on the device and prevents sharing
-Pre-populated text appears correctly based on the user's challenge situation

custom_steps_separated.content: From a Scoring Event tap Message icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Message sharing flow behaves correctly
-Flow can be canceled without sending any messages
-Message appears if Messaging has not be configured on the device and prevents sharing
-Pre-populated text appears correctly based on the user's challenge situation

custom_steps_separated.content: User taps on a scoring event in the log without At Bat installed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Prompt appears with an option to download At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: User accepts At Bat download prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is taken to At Bat in the app store

custom_steps_separated.content: User cancels/declines At Bat download prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is returned to Head to Head scoring log

custom_steps_separated.content: User taps View in At Bat on a scoring event with At Bat installed as a Lite user
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is taken from Head to Head to At Bat box score of the game where the scoring event occurred

custom_steps_separated.content: User taps View in At Bat on a scoring event with At Bat installed as a Full user
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is taken from Head to Head to At Bat Gameday view of the game where the scoring event occurred

custom_steps_separated.content: Repeat the above steps for multiple types of hitter scoring plays
custom_steps_separated.expected: Various types of hitter scoring plays are all correctly handled with View in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.expected: Which At Bat view? What about pitcher wins?
